p: In recent years, the number of scientific articles relating to aromatherapy and demonstrating its benefits has increased [ 3], that is why we naturally have opted, in our study, for the use of two essential oils (EOs) that of Thyme ( Thymus vulgaris L.) and Coriander ( Coriandrum sativum L.). These aromatic and medicinal plants are widely used, and their benefits have been recognized since Antiquity [ 4]. In fact, Thyme, widespread in Algeria, constitute an important remedy used since centuries and identified as a good source of bioactive compounds possessing significant antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties, potentially effective in prevention and treatment of pathological conditions [ 5], but what prompted us the most to choose it is its reputation of antibacterial molecule, especially against Enterobacteria, one of the most important bacteria in avian pathology [ 6]. Coriander, another aromatic plant common in the Mediterranean basin, also has EOs known for their antifungal, insecticides, and antibacterial effects [ 7, 8].
